column4: you could write a filesystem driver for it I guess, but since bchunk is around, nobody ever bothered
you can replace with the real device files if you like
it could be udf, or VCD, or all sorts
man bchunk will go through the options with you
it's pretty easy, especially since you actually have a .cue
whenever I've used it, I've had to write my own :/
cat <anyfile.cue>
it's ~4 lines
if you know what the .bin is meant to be, you can make good guesses as to what those lines should be
I was talking about writing my own .cue for bchink to use
isnt there a way to mount bin files directly too? would save 'a lot' of time not needing to convert the file to iso first, if that's what you are trying to do
there isn't, AFAIK
Im sure Ive seen it somewhere *going hunting*
it's possible using cdemu: http://www.bigbold.com/snippets/posts/show/2699
there's also a script to create cue files for bin files missing them in the how to: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=276743 ;)
tar -xf autodetects as well :)
*kisses* ;p
RFC rand(MAXINT); has a specification for CoffeeOverIP
it could also be the (correct :D) /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/build symlink
yeah
about the fd number error http://diveintomark.org/archives/2006/09/19/bad-fd-number
